body.name: NOBLEWELL Ergonomic Office Chair, Desk Chair with 2'' Adjustable Lumbar Support, Headrest, 2D Armrest, Office Chair Backrest 135° Rocking Relaxation, Computer Chair for Home Office

features: ERGONOMIC SUPPORT: Engineered to contour the natural curve of the human spine, the executive office chair provides exceptional support for your head, neck, shoulders, waist, hips, and arms. Perfect for users between 5'1'' and 6'1'' in height. Enjoy long-lasting comfort and maintain the correct sitting posture with NOBLEWELL ergonomic office chair.

BREATHABLE & COMFORTABLE FOR HOME AND WORK: The home office desk chairs backrest is made of breathable mesh that allows better airflow to your back to keep you cool and dry. While the seat is cushioned by 3.15″ high-density memory foam that contours your body and provide superior comfort. This chair is highly suitable for use as student study chairs, computer chairs, ergonomic chairs, desk chairs, gaming chairs, meeting chairs, task office chairs, computer task chairs, home office chairs.

FLEXIBLE ADJUSTMENT: The high back office chair customize your seat height between 3.9”. The 2” adjustable headrest ensures neck support, while the lumbar support can be fine-tuned by 2”. The backrest offers 90° to 135° recline to provide ideal relaxation. With 2D adjustable armrests extending by 3.9”, this desk chair suits various body types.

DURABLE & STABLE: Designed for reliability, our ergonomic desk chair has undergone rigorous testing. With an SGS-certified class 3 gas lift, sturdy steel base, and silent caster wheels, the office chair passed BIFMA durability stress tests, ensuring its dependability and stability.

EASY ASSEMBLY: The mesh office chair is equipped with all the necessary hardware kits for easy assembly. With clear instructions as your reference, you can fully assemble chair together in 8 easy steps in 10 minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice fit for home office and larger man
reviews.reviewText: This is our second of this chair. My husband is 6'1 and 240 and he's very comfortable in this chair. He loved the one we put in his home office, so he requested for his out of home office as well. Easy set up. Sturdy. He loves the ability to lean back and forth, like in a rocking motion and then the ability to set it into and lock the position. Great product at a great price point.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price
reviews.reviewText: Imagine you're a gamer and about 3 years ago you spent $300 on a chair and now it's broken and you need to replace it, but no way you're paying $300 for a chair again right? You just want something comfortable that will do the job but cheaper. This review is for you.From the time I pulled it inside to the time I was sitting in it took about 35 minutes. This included time I spent throwing the ball for my dog because he was confused why I was in the floor and checking in on funny moments during Seinfeld re-runs. Assembly was pretty straight forward and should be simple for anyone that knows how to read and comprehend instructions. There was one moment where I could imagine if you aren't very strong you may struggle lining the back piece up with the seat and getting the screws in properly so you may need some very brief assistance.Now that it's assembled, how does it compare to my $300 gaming chair? Overall it's comfortable, but I feel like I'm too big for the chair. I'm 5'11 about 205 lbs. Pretty average build. The arm rests are in perfect position. My arms rest nicely without having to adjust much at all. I feel too big for the chair for only 1 reason. The actual seat itself is pretty short. I wish it was another 3 to 4 inches longer. The seat ends mid thigh and I wish it ended just behind the fold of the back of my knees. You can recline the back just a bit to make up for this, but overall that's the only draw back.Overall I think it's great for the price and definitely satisfies my need. Good luck!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and quality
reviews.reviewText: I have purchased 3 of these chairs. They are adjustable and comfortable. They are sturdy and glide easily. The assembly instructions are clear. The wheels are a little difficult to push in, but you just have to work with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This chair is amazing. My wife and I are very pleased with this purchase. The assembly was simple and the instructions were easy to read and follow. The chair is very comfortable and I love the head rest. The arms are great and easy to adjust. Everything works well. I get nervous about chairs because often times there is something that doesn’t work. I’m happy that’s not the case with this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great price, looks great, like the meth but the seat will wear down
reviews.reviewText: I love the mesh back and after owning this for almost a year it doesn't loosen up. I also like the adjustable arm rests that allow my arms to sit at 90 degrees with my desk. However, I'm finding the seat to wear out.The cushion is almost non existent, but much better than a hard plastic seat.At this price range, I was fortunate to find a mesh back + adjustable arm rests + reclining lock.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for a great chair!
reviews.reviewText: I was looking at chairs at my local office store and the prices were a bit outrageous to me for a simple one. So I went on Amazon and found this gem. After reading reviews I decided to purchase it. That was over a year ago and I’ve been so happy with this chair since then! It’s super easy to assemble, comfortable and adjustable to your needs and for a great price. My brother got a similar chair at the office store and spent double what I did and I can’t tell the difference sitting in them!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not worth the price and the price is cheap.
reviews.reviewText: So I bought this chair in October of 2020 and have not put 6 months into this chair as my everyday work chair. So this review is more than a fresh and shiny, out-of-the-box, first impressions review.Build Quality:Pros: The butt pad is ok and the back mesh isn't terrible... that's about it.Cons: I'll start from the bottom and work my way up here.*The post is not square to the wheels so the plain of the chair is not parallel to the plane of the floor. This makes the chair feel like it is leaning in a direction depending on the orientation of the wheels.*The butt part of the chair is slightly leaned forward but not much, just enough to be uncomfortable over time. Compounded with the out of square post this can make it feel like you are hunched forward with all your weight on the backs of your knees if the wheels are in the wrong direction.*The adjustable arms have a different number of settings on each side and they are not aligned so the two arms cannot be set to the same height.*The reclining feature does not grab well so after you adjust it to any position and lean back it makes a horrendous loud pop before it grabs the back and stops the movement.*The post that holds the back will bend if I lean back because it is just a pipe that is flatted at one end and welded to the plate that attaches to the back so the flatted end just bends easily. Just a stupid design in every way.*Of the 4 threaded inserts in the back panel 3 of them pulled out after a month or two just from moving around in the chair. Mine is now just epoxied to the back panel's post because I spent a bunch of money on a chair and it is too late to send it back.*The back post is slightly out of perpendicular to the base (or the post is slightly bent) so the back feels tilted to the right.Comfort:Pros: None. The build quality has ensured that nothing is aligned properly.Durability: Because I didn't really recline it at all or I didn't notice the weak back post until it was too late to return. If I had I would have returned it before the threaded inserts started coming out by week 5. The popping in the reclining function is slowly getting worse but I am not terribly afraid it will fail because I doubt the bending back post will outlast it.TLDR: I wish I had spent my money on another chair. Learn from my mistake. This chair is garbage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for the money.
reviews.reviewText: For the price I don’t think you could go wrong. Comfortable and feels tough enough!I was surprised by how nice it looked in person too.Cons:- I know it’s not labeled as reclining, but I feel like it sits too straight up, and the back doesn’t have much travel.- At 6’ 1” the headrest is useless. At the tallest setting it becomes very flimsy, and offers no support. However my 5’ girlfriend find it very comfortable when adjusted to her.Overall totally think it’s worth it, though I’ll probably try to find a taller aftermarket headrest!
I found it easy to assemble. The instructions were clear and everything came in the box. It is a comfortable chair and I love the option to adjust the arm resting.

Really good chair, easy to put together but the chair is a tad bit high for shorter people. on the lowest setting its still a bit high. not a deal breaker but shorter people might wanna avoid it. other than that a solid choice for sure

Can't be beat for what I paid on lightning deal sale. 145 - 35 coupon = $110cdnVery comfortable chair in its price range even at regular price.FYI.. It's a very tall chair, I'm average height and my feet just touch the ground on the lowest setting.The height adjustable arms is a great feature as you can set the height to make it parallel with your mouse and keyboard.
The chair is excellent and easy do assemble. I bought two and would buy more if necessary.

The chair was easy to assemble and the seat and the back are comfortable enough, but1. It is not for short people. I am 165cm tall and even lowered to the max this chair is too tall for me, my feet barely stand fully on the floor, hence the back support is pointless, because my posture is not right.2. The arms of the chair are different height as well - it's noticeable when readjusting them to fit over or under the tabletop.3. It also came with stains on the plastic parts of the frame and paint scratched off the metal parts. Don't know if it's a manufacturer's defect or damage from shipping.So overall the chair is not a good fit for me. Which is very disappointing, it's so hard to find a comfortable chair for an adequate price.
